scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes CLV in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Core Vocabularies can be used as the foundation of common export formats for data in base registries like cadastral, business registers or public service portals. The Core Location Vocabulary is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of a location, represented as an address, a geographic name, or a geometry. By describing locations (addresses, geographical names, etc) in a common way using both human and machine-readable format, it allows the publication of information as open data for its consultation and reuse.

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

CLV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-location-vocabulary

Use cases and benefits of ISA² specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/docs/publications/isa2_study_use_cases_and_benefits_of_isa2_specifications_january_2019.pdf

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) has established Working Groups. These Working Groups are open to the participation of everyone interested in semantic solutions working for public administrations in the Member States or in EU institutions.

SEMIC working groups:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
​The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) that developed this specification, is in charge of developing solutions to help European public administrations perform seamless and meaningful cross-border and cross-domain data exchanges. They develop semantic specifications and interoperability solutions under the ISA² Programme. When a new solution release is finished, it is submitted for a public review with a minimum period of four weeks.

Specification development process by the ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/document/description-change-management-release-and-publication-process-structural-metadata-specifications

Detailed document ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/document/2016-10/description_of_a_change_management_release_and_publication_process_for_structural_metadata_specifications_developed_by_the_isa_progr.pdf

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The purpose of the Core Location Vocabulary is to capture the fundamental characteristics of a location, represented as an address, a geographic name or geometry. It was developed from November 2011 until February 2012. It had some updates, and it was finally published in May 2012. This fact shows that CLV is mature enough for its use in the development of products and services.

CLV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-location-vocabulary

criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The Core Location Vocabulary has a good market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services. For example, it has been used to create the OSLO Vocabulary which is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of information exchanged by public administration in Flanders.

OSLO Vocabulary:

statement:
The purpose of the Core Location Vocabulary is to create a reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics related to people, locations and businesses. By providing a set of information to describe data in the sectors mentioned before, it helps public administrations with the visualization of people, locations or business.

criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The adoption of CLV as a data model does not hamper the scalability of systems. The use of existing data models for the development of common information systems facilitates the development of those systems and improves their interoperability. Additionally, as it happens with all the Core Vocabularies, it can be extended to properly cover a specific need under a specific domain.

statement:
The Core Location Vocabulary facilitates the process for institutions to classify and to describe data about location aspects of public organisations, citizens, and businesses. By ensuring the reuse of information among administrations and systems, it fosters interoperability and impacts positively on the development of eGovernment.

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the CLV in terms of efficiency or effectiveness. However, there is an ISA2 documentation where there are defined use cases and benefits of using its solutions, including the different Core Vocabularies. 

Use cases and benefits of ISA² specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/docs/publications/isa2_study_use_cases_and_benefits_of_isa2_specifications_january_2019.pdf

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
The Core Location Vocabulary is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, CLV can define the interoperability aspects of the "Core Data Model" and "Data" ABBs of the EIRA Semantic View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
As a vocabulary, the implementation of CLV can be tested using methods like SHACL shapes and using semantic reasoners to ensure that the implementation is well-formed. These validation mechanisms can be used with open source tools or lite versions of tools like GrapghDB or Protégé.

SHACL validation:
https://graphdb.ontotext.com/documentation/free/shacl-validation.html#what-is-shacl-validation

Semantic Reasoners List:
http://owl.cs.manchester.ac.uk/tools/list-of-reasoners/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of CLV is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The Core Location Vocabulary is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of a location, represented as an address, a geographic name, or a geometry. 

CLV Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-location-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Core Vocabularies can be used as the foundation of common export formats for data in base registries like cadastral, business registers or public service portals. The Core Location Vocabulary is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of a location, represented as an address, a geographic name, or a geometry. 

By describing locations (addresses, geographical names, etc) in a common way using both human and machine-readable format, it allows the publication of information as linked open data for its consultation and reuse.

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
